main_definition: In a state of readiness or having made ready in advance.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Ready with something planned and arranged beforehand.
meanings_and_examples.example: She was prepared for the meeting, with all her notes and presentation slides organized.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Equipped or furnished as required for a particular purpose or activity.
meanings_and_examples.example: The chef was well-prepared to cook gourmet meals after receiving extensive culinary training.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Mentally and physically ready to face something challenging or unexpected.
meanings_and_examples.example: Despite the sudden weather change, they were prepared with raincoats and umbrellas.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A person who has studied for an examination thoroughly.
meanings_and_examples.example: He was so well-prepared that he aced his final exams without much trouble.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To make ready or complete something, often in advance of needing it.
meanings_and_examples.example: The hiker packed and prepared her backpack with all the necessary supplies before setting off on the trail.
